title: oc100
description: Introductory college level course on oceanography, covering the fundamental principles of ocean science, including ocean basins, seawater chemistry, ocean circulation, marine life, and human impacts on the ocean environment.

modules.title: Introduction to Oceanography and Ocean Basins
modules.description: This module introduces the field of oceanography and explores the formation and structure of ocean basins.

topics.title: Overview
topics.description: Course introduction and objectives, overview of oceanography as a multidisciplinary science.

topics.title: The History of Ocean Exploration
topics.description: A review of significant historical events and figures in ocean exploration.

topics.title: Earth's Structure and Plate Tectonics
topics.description: Understanding the Earth's internal structure and the theory of plate tectonics.

topics.title: Formation of Ocean Basins
topics.description: The processes involved in the creation and evolution of ocean basins.

topics.title: Continental Margins
topics.description: Features and characteristics of continental shelves, slopes, and rises.

topics.title: Deep-Ocean Floor Features
topics.description: Exploring abyssal plains, mid-ocean ridges, trenches, and seamounts.

topics.title: Ocean Sediments
topics.description: Types, distribution, and significance of marine sediments.

topics.title: Resources from the Sea
topics.description: An overview of the valuable resources from the sea.

topics.title: Bathymetry and Mapping the Ocean Floor
topics.description: Techniques used to measure ocean depth and create bathymetric maps.

topics.title: Ocean Provinces
topics.description: Overview of ocean provinces from coastal regions to the open ocean.

topics.title: Module 1 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 1 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Seawater Chemistry and Physical Properties
modules.description: This module delves into the chemical composition of seawater and its physical properties, such as temperature, salinity, and density.

topics.title: Chemical Composition of Seawater
topics.description: Major ions, dissolved gases, and trace elements in seawater.

topics.title: Salinity and its Variations
topics.description: Factors affecting salinity and its distribution in the ocean.

topics.title: Temperature and Density
topics.description: The relationship between temperature, density, and ocean stratification.

topics.title: The pH of Seawater
topics.description: Understanding the carbonate buffering system and ocean acidification.

topics.title: Dissolved Gases
topics.description: Oxygen, carbon dioxide, and nitrogen in seawater.

topics.title: Water Masses
topics.description: Formation and characteristics of different water masses.

topics.title: Light in the Ocean
topics.description: Absorption and scattering of light in seawater.

topics.title: Sound in the Ocean
topics.description: Propagation of sound and its uses in oceanography.

topics.title: Measuring Seawater Properties
topics.description: Techniques and instruments used to measure temperature, salinity, and density.

topics.title: Conservative and Non-Conservative Properties
topics.description: Understanding conservative and non-conservative seawater properties.

topics.title: Module 2 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 2 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Ocean Circulation
modules.description: This module explores the patterns and drivers of ocean currents, including surface currents and deep-ocean circulation.

topics.title: Surface Currents
topics.description: Wind-driven currents and gyre formation.

topics.title: The Coriolis Effect
topics.description: Understanding the influence of Earth's rotation on ocean currents.

topics.title: Ekman Transport
topics.description: The net transport of water due to wind and the Coriolis effect.

topics.title: Upwelling and Downwelling
topics.description: Processes that bring nutrient-rich water to the surface or transport surface water downward.

topics.title: Thermohaline Circulation
topics.description: Density-driven circulation and the global conveyor belt.

topics.title: Ocean-Atmosphere Interactions
topics.description: The exchange of heat, moisture, and momentum between the ocean and atmosphere.

topics.title: El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO)
topics.description: Understanding El Niño and La Niña events.

topics.title: Ocean Waves
topics.description: Wave formation, characteristics, and behavior.

topics.title: Tides
topics.description: The gravitational forces that cause tides.

topics.title: Coastal Processes
topics.description: Erosion, deposition, and sediment transport along coastlines.

topics.title: Module 3 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 3 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Marine Life and Ecosystems
modules.description: This module explores the diversity of marine life, marine ecosystems, and the interactions between organisms and their environment.

topics.title: Classification of Marine Organisms
topics.description: Plankton, nekton, and benthos.

topics.title: Primary Productivity
topics.description: Photosynthesis and chemosynthesis in the ocean.

topics.title: Food Webs and Trophic Levels
topics.description: The flow of energy through marine ecosystems.

topics.title: Phytoplankton
topics.description: Diatoms, dinoflagellates, and other microscopic algae.

topics.title: Zooplankton
topics.description: Copepods, krill, and other small animals that drift in the ocean.

topics.title: Marine Invertebrates
topics.description: Sponges, corals, mollusks, and crustaceans.

topics.title: Marine Vertebrates
topics.description: Fish, marine mammals, sea turtles, and seabirds.

topics.title: Deep-Sea Ecosystems
topics.description: Hydrothermal vents, cold seeps, and the organisms that inhabit them.

topics.title: Coral Reefs
topics.description: Structure, biodiversity, and threats to coral reefs.

topics.title: Estuaries and Coastal Wetlands
topics.description: Ecological importance and vulnerability of estuaries and wetlands.

topics.title: Module 4 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 4 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Human Impacts on the Ocean
modules.description: This module examines the various ways human activities are affecting the ocean environment.

topics.title: Marine Pollution
topics.description: Sources and types of pollution, including plastics, oil spills, and chemical runoff.

topics.title: Ocean Acidification
topics.description: The impact of increased carbon dioxide levels on ocean pH and marine life.

topics.title: Overfishing
topics.description: The depletion of fish stocks and its consequences for marine ecosystems.

topics.title: Habitat Destruction
topics.description: The loss of coral reefs, mangroves, and other important marine habitats.

topics.title: Climate Change and the Ocean
topics.description: The effects of climate change on sea level, ocean temperature, and ocean circulation.

topics.title: Invasive Species
topics.description: The introduction and spread of non-native species in marine environments.

topics.title: Eutrophication
topics.description: Excessive nutrient enrichment and its impact on water quality.

topics.title: Dead Zones
topics.description: Areas of low oxygen concentration that cannot support marine life.

topics.title: Plastic Pollution in the Ocean
topics.description: Sources, distribution, and impacts of plastic pollution.

topics.title: Microplastics
topics.description: The presence and impact of microplastics in the marine environment.

topics.title: Module 5 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 5 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Ocean Conservation and Management
modules.description: This module explores strategies for protecting and managing ocean resources sustainably.

topics.title: Marine Protected Areas (MPAs)
topics.description: The role of MPAs in conserving marine biodiversity.

topics.title: Sustainable Fisheries Management
topics.description: Strategies for managing fisheries to ensure long-term sustainability.

topics.title: Pollution Reduction Strategies
topics.description: Methods for reducing pollution from land-based and marine sources.

topics.title: Coastal Zone Management
topics.description: Integrated management of coastal resources and ecosystems.

topics.title: Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation
topics.description: Strategies for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and adapting to the impacts of climate change.

topics.title: International Agreements and Treaties
topics.description: International efforts to protect the ocean environment.

topics.title: Ecosystem-Based Management
topics.description: Managing human activities to maintain the health and integrity of marine ecosystems.

topics.title: Restoration of Marine Habitats
topics.description: Techniques for restoring degraded marine habitats, such as coral reefs and mangroves.

topics.title: Marine Debris Removal
topics.description: Efforts to clean up plastic and other debris from the ocean.

topics.title: Citizen Science and Ocean Monitoring
topics.description: The role of citizen scientists in collecting data and monitoring ocean health.

topics.title: Module 6 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 6 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Ocean Law and Policy
modules.description: This module examines the legal and policy frameworks governing the use and protection of the ocean.

topics.title: The Law of the Sea
topics.description: The United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS).

topics.title: Maritime Zones
topics.description: Internal waters, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone (EEZ), and high seas.

topics.title: Navigation Rights
topics.description: Freedom of navigation and innocent passage.

topics.title: Marine Resource Management
topics.description: Legal frameworks for managing fisheries, mineral resources, and other marine resources.

topics.title: Marine Environmental Protection
topics.description: Legal frameworks for preventing and addressing marine pollution.

topics.title: Dispute Resolution
topics.description: Mechanisms for resolving disputes related to ocean issues.

topics.title: National Ocean Policies
topics.description: Ocean policies and laws of various countries.

topics.title: International Organizations
topics.description: The role of international organizations in ocean governance.

topics.title: The Arctic Ocean
topics.description: Special legal and policy issues related to the Arctic Ocean.

topics.title: Deep Seabed Mining
topics.description: Legal and environmental issues related to deep seabed mining.

topics.title: Module 7 Review
topics.description: Review key concepts and prepare for module assessment.

topics.title: Module 7 Assessment
topics.description: Test your understanding of the material covered in the module.

modules.title: Capstone Project: Oceanographic Research and Solutions
modules.description: This module provides students with the opportunity to apply their knowledge to a real-world oceanographic problem and develop potential solutions.

topics.title: Project Introduction and Topic Selection
topics.description: Introduction to the capstone project and guidelines for selecting a research topic.

topics.title: Literature Review and Research Design
topics.description: Conducting a literature review and developing a research design.

topics.title: Data Collection and Analysis
topics.description: Collecting and analyzing data related to the research topic.

topics.title: Developing Solutions and Recommendations
topics.description: Developing potential solutions and recommendations based on research findings.

topics.title: Project Report Writing
topics.description: Writing a comprehensive project report that summarizes the research and findings.

topics.title: Presentation Skills
topics.description: Preparing and delivering an effective presentation on the capstone project.

topics.title: Peer Review and Feedback
topics.description: Providing and receiving feedback on project reports and presentations.

topics.title: Project Presentation
topics.description: Presenting the capstone project to the class.

topics.title: Project Submission
topics.description: Submitting the final project report.

topics.title: Project Grading and Evaluation
topics.description: Grading criteria and evaluation of the capstone project.

topics.title: Course Review
topics.description: Comprehensive review of the course material.

topics.title: Final Exam
topics.description: Comprehensive final exam covering all course material.
